summary: Brie Larson protagonizará I’m Thinking Of Ending Things, la nueva película que adaptará y dirigirá Charlie Kaufman para Netflix,...
caption: Brie Larson protagonizará I’m Thinking Of Ending Things, la nueva película que adaptará y dirigirá Charlie Kaufman para Netflix, estará basada en la novela de Iain Reid, en la cual la trama gira alrededor del road trip que realizan Jake y su novia (quien quiere romper la relación) , al encontrarse con mal clima se ven obligados a parar, el sale del auto para buscar ayuda pero nunca regresa, ella decide buscarlo y empiezan a ocurrir cosas salidas de pesadillas.

summary: Netflix Film I'M THINKING OF ENDING THINGS Sets Brie Larson As Star
title: Netflix Film I'M THINKING OF ENDING THINGS Sets Brie Larson As Star
body:
Brie Larson (Captain Marvel) is in talks to star in I’m Thinking Of Ending Things the new project from Charlie Kaufman. Based on Iain Reid’s 2016 novel, the plot centers on Jake, who is on a road trip to meet his parents on their secluded farm with his girlfriend (Larson), who is thinking of ending things.…

Netflix Film I’M THINKING OF ENDING THINGS Sets Brie Larson As Star was originally published on Hollywood News Source

summary: Captain Marvel - Official Trailer #2
title: Captain Marvel - Official Trailer #2
body:
Captain Marvel’s second official trailer has arrived and finally reveals the answer to the question we’ve all been asking… why did Carol Danvers punch that Grandma?

The new film is a prequel to every MCU movie so far and the first Marvel superhero film with a female lead! Set in the 1990’s Carol Danvers/ Captain Marvel is a fighter pilot turned ‘most powerful hero in the universe’ who finds herself in a war between two alien species, the Kree and the Skrulls. Check out the full trailer below!

The character was first teased in the Avengers: Infinity War post-credits scene *SPOILERS* where we watched Nick Fury contact Danvers with a futuristic pager before turning to dust *END SPOILERS*. 

Captain Marvel is also expected to play a large role in 2019’s Avengers 4, however, we’ll need to wait for the first trailer (rumoured this week) before we can definitively say that. Anyway, here’s a new poster!

Captain Marvel is out in theatres on March 8, 2019, and stars Brie Larson, Samuel L. Jackson, Ben Mendelsohn, Djimon Hounsou, Lee Pace, Lashana Lynch, Gemma Chan, Annette Bening, Clark Gregg, and Jude Law.

Opinion: Personally, I found both trailers for Captain Marvel to be pretty generic. With that said, I’m incredibly excited for this movie as I’m a huge fan of Brie Larson; I’m excited about the character, for the return of Nick Fury, Agent Coulson, and the Guardians duo too. Also, that space fight scene!

Looking for more from me? Follow me on Twitter to keep up to date with my latest posts, video game related nonsense, or if you just want to say hey!
